intro: Amellus asper, commonly known as the rough amellus, is a perennial flowering plant native to the temperate regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Amellus asper is often found in woodland edges and along stream banks, where it contributes to the local biodiversity.
